member.summary: A brush that paints a pattern cell that is repeated from right to left, from top to bottom.

member.summary: Creates a new TilingBrush with an empty pattern.
member.remarks:
Add shapes to the Pattern. The pattern is repeated across the area that is filled.
XML
<paragraph type="textparagraph"> <border> <background type="tilingbrush"> <pattern width="50" height="50"> <shape type="rectangleshape" x="0" y="0" width="25" height="25"> <pen color="green" width="1"/> </shape> </pattern> </background> </border> <fragment font="helvetica" fontsize="24"> Tiling brush in XML </fragment> </paragraph>

member.summary: Get the name of the color as it can be parsed again.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Colors.Color.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a string to extract a color.
member.remarks:
The string representation of a color can be on of the following:
Format Description
#RRGGBB
Web color. Each component is a 2-digit hexadecimal number (00 - FF). For example: #9963FA
gray
Gray color. gray is a value in the range 0 - 255. For example: 128
r,g,b
RGB color. Each component is a value in the range 0 - 255. For example: 128,5,233
c,m,y,k
CMYK color. Each component is a value in the range 0 - 255. For example: 12,255,6,128
ColorName
A named color. Currently supported are all named colors available in System.Drawing.Color. For example: SkyBlue
Instead of the fixed values (0-255) also a relative value (0%-100%) is allowed. This is converted to 0-255.
member.returns: A Color.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Css.CssStyleSheet.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the CssStyleSheet class.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the loaction of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is a complete url
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- the application is running in a web context: the web path are resolved locally.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Css.CssStyleSheet.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the CssStyleSheet class.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the loaction of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is already a complete url
- basepath is a url, appends the stylesheetName
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- path is a local file (relative to given basepath)
- the application is running in a web context: the web paths are resolved locally.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Css.CssStyleSheet.ApplyStyleSheetFromPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Process a batch of styles from a given location and apply them to the current stylesheet.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the loaction of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is already a complete url
- basepath is a url, appends the path
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- path is a local file (relative to given basepath)
- the application is running in a web context: the web paths are resolved locally.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.
The base path to load the style sheet from.

member.remarks: Do not override this class directly in your code.

The class instance that calculates the PKCS#1 and PKCS#7
The subject name in the signing certificate (the element "CN")

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.DigitalSignatures.StandardSignatureHandler.Create(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.DigitalSignatures.Pkcs12Store,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new StandardSignatureHandler best suited for a signing certificate.
member.remarks:
This method creates a signature handler best suited for signing based on the signing certificate's properties.
Note that a complete chain of certificates up to the root CA certificate or a self signed certificate is required within the key store.
member.param: The key store containing the private key.
The name that is associated with the private key in the store.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Fields.FieldShape.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border of this form field.
member.remarks:
The default border color is black.
For the SignatureFieldShape the default border color is (transparent).
This color doesn't have any meaning if the border width is zero.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Fields.FieldShape.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width in points of the border of this form field.

Default = 1.
Set to zero if you doesn't want a border

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Fields.FieldShape.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color of this form field.
member.remarks:
Default backgroundcolor = white.
For the PushButtonFieldShape the default background color is light gray.
For the SignatureFieldShape the default background color is (transparent).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Fields.FieldShape.BorderStyle
member.summary: The border style of this form field.
member.remarks:
The default borderstyle is solid.
For the pushbutton the default borderstyle = Beveled.
For the radiobutton the default borderstyle = inset.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Fields.FieldShape.Orientation
member.summary: Orientation of field in degrees (counter-clockwise).

remarks.para: Default is Rotate0.
Shape.Rotation is not respected for any field shape.

member.summary: Read this object from an XmlReader.

member.summary: The data that is represented by this barcode.

member.summary: The textual representation of the data as it appears with the barcode.

member.summary: Maximum length of data. Default: 12.

member.summary: If, and how the textual respresentation of the data is displayed. Default: None.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.UseQuiteZone
member.summary: Add a quiet zone to the left and to the right of the barcode. Default: false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.Width
member.summary: The actual width of the barcode. If set to 0 (default), the minimum width will be used.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.Height
member.summary: The actual height of the barcode. If set to 0 (default), the minimum height will be used.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.MinimumHeight
member.summary: The recommended minimum height (in points) of the barcode given the current settings. It is possible to set the height smaller than the minimum height but then the content will be clipped.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.MinimumWidth
member.summary: The recommended minimum width (in points) of the barcode given the current settings. It is possible to set the width smaller than the minimum width but then the content will be clipped.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.BarcodeShape.XDimension
member.summary: The x-dimension (narrowest element of a bar code symbol) in mils. 1 mil = 0.001 inch. E.g. A 7.5 mil x-dimension means that the most narrow bar code element measures 0.0075 inches. Default: 13.5.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape
member.summary: Barcode 128 shape.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new Code 128 barcode.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Code 128 barcode.
member.param: The Data. This should not include the start and end codes '*'.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.Display
member.summary: The textual representation of the data as it appears with the barcode.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.QuiteZone
member.summary: The effective width of the quite zone in points. The quite zone is the empty space at both the left and right side of the bar code. Property Width includes the quite zone.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.CharacterSet
member.summary: The character set this Code 128 barcode will use. (default=B)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.GS1Compatible
member.summary: Whether this barcode is GS1-128 compatibly (default false).
member.remarks: Setting to true will insert the FNC1 character [102] on the second position, making it compatible with GS1-128 (previously known as UCC/EAN-128 or EAN-128)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.Code128BarcodeShape.MinimumWidth
member.summary: The effective width (in points) of the barcode given the current settings. Includes the quite zone.

members.member: Generates the 2D barcode PDF417. Supports dimensioning auto-sizing, fixed and variable sizes, automatic and manual error levels, raw codeword input, codeword size optimization and bitmap inversion.
Creates a new PDF417BarCodeHelper with the default settings.
Sets the File ID for macro PDF417 encoding @param id the file id
Set the default settings that correspond to PDF417_USE_ASPECT_RATIO and PDF417_AUTO_ERROR_LEVEL.
Paints the barcode. If no exception was thrown a valid barcode is available.
Gets the number of X pixels of outBits. @return the number of X pixels of outBits
Gets the codeword array. This array is always 928 elements long. It can be writen to if the option PDF417_USE_RAW_CODEWORDS is set. @return the codeword array
Sets the length of the codewords. @param lenCodewords the length of the codewords
Sets the Y pixel height relative to X. It is usually 3. @param yHeight the Y pixel height relative to X
Auto-size is made based on aspectRatio and yHeight.
The size of the barcode will be at least codeColumns*codeRows.
The size will be at least codeColumns with a variable number of codeRows.
The size will be at least codeRows with a variable number of codeColumns.
The error level correction is set automatically according to ISO 15438 recomendations.
The error level correction is set by the user. It can be 0 to 8.
One single binary segment is used
No text interpretation is done and the content of codewords is used directly.
Inverts the output bits of the raw bitmap that is normally bit one for black. It has only effect for the raw bitmap.
Holds value of property outBits.
Holds value of property bitColumns.
Holds value of property codeRows.
Holds value of property codeColumns.
Holds value of property codewords.
Holds value of property lenCodewords.
Holds value of property errorLevel.
Holds value of property text.
Holds value of property options.
Holds value of property aspectRatio.
Holds value of property yHeight.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Barcodes.QRBarcodeShape
member.summary: QR (Quick Response) code shape.

remarks.para: The physical size of the QR code is given by its Width and Height in points. The number of "dots" dat get generated depends on the value of the Data parameter. More data implies a QR code with more (and smaller) dots. The current implementation will always generate a code with error correction level "M".
The Quiet zone property is ignored, as QR codes incorporate a mandatory "quiet zone". The DataLength and XDimension properties are currently also ignored.

member.summary: Create a new QR code.

member.summary: Do not change the blend mode, but interit it from it's container.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color, then complements the result. Note: Screening any color with white results in white; screening with black leaved the original color unchanged.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Note: Paiting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produce no change.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color (see difference, but with lowel contrast). Note: Paiting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produce no change.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.Canvas
member.summary: Each page has 4 canvasses: an underlay, a visual underlay, an overlay and a visual overlay, all of type Canvas. You draw underneath or on top of a page by adding shapes to one of the 4 layer objects. The layers are non-creatable and retrieved through the [Visual]Underlay and [Visual]Overlay properties of a page object.
member.remarks: The underlay and overlay uses the original coordinate system and doesn't respect page orientation and/or any clipping area. The visual underlay and visual overlay uses a coordinate system that does respect page orientation and/or any clipping area. The visual layer will be placed exact on the resulting visual area shown in a viewer (e.g. Acrobat Reader). Note that if no rotation and/or clipping is available that the visual layer has the same result as the normal layer.

member.remarks: The frame index will be 0, not the current active frame index. The referenced bitmap must be disposed by the client (caller) after the pdf document (page with this ImageShape) has been written

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new ImageShape from a System.Drawing.Bitmap. This constructor allows you to draw to a GDI+ surface and pass it to the ImageShape class without intermediate, temporary file.
member.param: The bitmap will be disposed by this component (callee)
member.remarks: The frame index will be 0, not the current active frame index When setting disposeBitmap to true, the bitmap is disposed when this Image class is release from memory. Note that if this instance of the bitmap is used multiple times an error will be thrown if this bitmap is used after this Image class is removed from memory.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.Compression
member.summary: The compression to apply to the image data.
member.remarks: This is a best-effort setting. Images that are already compressed will in most cases not be recoded to another compression. Uncompressed images will honor the compression setting.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.MaskColor
member.summary: Set the color that will act as the transparent color.
member.remarks:
Setting this color to any other color than will enable color masking. The color that matches this color exactly will become transparent.
When the mask color is set, alpha transparency is ignored.
For GIF images, the mask color can be specified in the file. Setting the MaskColor will override the transparent color in the GIF file.
Color masking for images with lossy compression (JPEG) is not advised.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.FrameIndex
member.summary: The FrameIndex which will be used to get the actual image data from the Bitmap

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.FrameCount
member.summary: The number of frames in the image.
member.remarks: Most image types hold a single frame. TIFF images can have multiple frames. Use to select the frame to show.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.GetFrameCount(System.String)
member.summary: Extract the number of frames from the image data.
member.param: The path to the image. May be a file path or a URL.
member.returns: Number of frames in this image.
member.example:
VB.NET
' Get the number of frames Dim frameCount As Integer = ImageShape.GetFrameCount( path ) Dim index As Integer
For index = 0 To frameCount - 1 ' Load the image for the frame Dim image as ImageShape = New ImageShape(path, index)
'Create new page and append to document Dim page As New Page(image.Width, image.Height) document.Pages.Append(page) page.VisualOverlay.Add(image) Next index

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.GetFrameCount(System.String,System.Object,TallComponents.PDF.Layout.GetWebCredentialsEventHandler)
member.summary: Extract the number of frames from the image data.
member.param: The path to the image. May be a file path or a URL.
The sender for the GetWebCredentials event.
The event handlers to query for the web credentials.
member.returns: Number of frames in this image.
member.example:
VB.NET
' Get the number of frames Dim frameCount As Integer = ImageShape.GetFrameCount( path ) Dim index As Integer
For index = 0 To frameCount - 1 ' Load the image for the frame Dim image as ImageShape = New ImageShape(path, index)
'Create new page and append to document Dim page As New Page(image.Width, image.Height) document.Pages.Append(page) page.VisualOverlay.Add(image) Next index

member.summary: Extract the number of frames from the image data.
member.remarks: The may be closed when the method completes and it is no longer needed. It is the responsibility of the client to close the stream.
member.param: A stream containing an image file.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.GetFrameCount(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Extract the number of frames from the image data.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.Path
member.summary: Relative or absolute path of image file.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.Height
member.summary: The height of the image.
member.remarks:
If KeepAspectRatio is set:
If both the height and width are not specified: use PhysicalWidth and PhysicalHeight.
Width is specified, no height specified: The height is calculated from the width (and height property is ignored).
Height is specified, no width specified: The width is calculated from the height (and width property is ignored).
If both the height and width are specified: fit into area.
Set to double.NaN to reset to the initial state (not set, use PhysicalHeight)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.Width
member.summary: The width of the image.
member.remarks:
If KeepAspectRatio is set:
If both the height and width are not specified: use PhysicalWidth and PhysicalHeight.
Width is specified, no height specified: The height is calculated from the width (and height property is ignored).
Height is specified, no width specified: The width is calculated from the height (and width property is ignored).
If both the height and width are specified: fit into area.
Set to double.NaN to reset to the initial state (not set, use PhysicalWidth)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.VerticalSize
member.summary: Get the vertical size (height) in pixels of this image.
member.remarks: This property cannot be set, it's readonly.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.HorizontalSize
member.summary: Get the horizontal size (width) in pixels of this image.
member.remarks: This property cannot be set, it's readonly.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.VerticalResolution
member.summary: Get the vertical resolution, in pixels per inch, of this image.
member.remarks:
Returns 0 (zero) if this information is not available in the image.
This property cannot be set, it's readonly.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.HorizontalResolution
member.summary: Get the horizontal resolution, in pixels per inch, of this image.
member.remarks:
Returns 0 (zero) if this information is not available in the image.
This property cannot be set, it's readonly.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.AspectRatio
member.summary: The pixel aspect ratio based on the physical image dimensions.
member.remarks: This includes a correction for images that have a different horizontal and vertical resolution.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.PhysicalHeight
member.summary: The height where the resolution has been applied to.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.PhysicalWidth
member.summary: The width where the resolution has been applied to.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.KeepAspectRatio
member.summary: If KeepAspectRatio is set to true, the height is calculated from the width so that the width/height ratio is equal to the columns/rows ratio of the raster of the original image. If set to false, the specified width and height are used and the image will in general appear distorted.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.IgnoreAlpha
member.summary: Set to true to completely ignore alpha transparency in the image. If no alpha information is available this setting is ignored. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Note that setting a MaskColor will cause all alpha information to be ignored.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ImageShape.InvertCmykChannels
member.summary: Set to true to invert the colors in a CMYK image.
member.remarks: Default = false.

member.remarks: It is not guaranteed that the requires compression will actually be used for each image type.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape
member.summary: The MultilineTextShape allows you to stamp text that is wrapped given a certain maximum line width. The text is stored in 1 or more fragments. You can set layout properties such as alignment and indentation.

remarks.para: The origin (X and Y properties) is the top-left position.
Use a LineBreakFragment to insert a newline between two fragments.

member.summary: Width of this MultilineTextShape.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.Height
member.summary: Height of this MultilineTextShape, when the contents should be auto-sized. The content will be auto-sized when the following constaints are true: 1) Only one fragment is present; 2) The font-size in that fragment is specified as zero (0).
member.remarks: If this MultilineTextShape isn't auto-sized, this height property isn't used at all.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.MeasuredHeight
member.summary: The measured height is the space that will be used when drawing this shape on the page. This height is calculated with the fragments available in the fragments collection, it respects the Width property and font-sizes used in the fragments.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.MeasuredWidth
member.summary: The measured width is the space that will be used when drawing this shape on the page. This width is calculated with the fragments available in the fragments collection, it respects the Width property and font-sizes used in the fragments.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.TabStops
member.summary: Allows you to define points to jump to when a tab character is encountered.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.FlowDirection
member.summary: The read direction of text elements (fragments).
member.remarks: The fragments contained can have a different read direction to allow left-to-right reading elements (numbers) in right to left text.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.MaxFontSize
member.summary: The maximum font size the auto-sized text will be (default = 24).
member.remarks: If this MultilineTextShape isn't auto-sized, this property isn't used at all.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.Clone
member.summary: Clones a Shape.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MultilineTextShape.TextFieldMode
member.summary: We need to set the Shape in 'special' mode, because acrobat dispays text different then we do. However we do not want to change it for all text we display.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape
member.summary: A page shape is a placeholder for an existing page. It is used to stamp existing pages on an other page, which could be either a new or an existing page.
member.remarks: Placing a page using the PageShape removes all interactive features such as links and form fields.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new page shape. Use Path, Password and PageIndex to specify what page to use.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int32,TallComponents.PDF.Layout.PageBoundary)
member.summary: Create a new page shape. Using the specified page boundary.
member.remarks: The may be closed when the constructor completes. It is the responsibility of the client to close the stream.
member.param: The password needed to open the given PDF.
The horizontal position of the left edge of this page shape.
The vertical position of the bottom edge of this page shape.
The width of this page shape.
The height of this page shape.
The width/height ratio is equal to the ratio of the original page.
The rotation the page shape counter-clockwise (360 corresponds to a full circle).

This shape has the contents from the specified page boundary. If the page does not have the specified page boundary, then it will be automatically using the following fallback: ArtBox --> CropBox; TrimBox --> CropBox; BleedBox --> CropBox; CropBox --> MediaBox.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new PageShape from a PDF document in a stream with the original size of the page.
member.remarks:
This constructor uses the Default page boundry to determine the page's size.
The may be closed when the constructor completes. It is the responsibility of the client to close the stream.
member.param: The password needed to open the given PDF.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int32,TallComponents.PDF.Layout.PageBoundary)
member.summary: Create a new page shape. Using the specified page boundary.
member.remarks: Loading PDF documents from a URL is currently not supported. You can use relative paths in a web environment (for example ~/documents/mydoc.pdf)
member.param: The password needed to open the given PDF.
The horizontal position of the left edge of this page shape.
The vertical position of the bottom edge of this page shape.
The width of this page shape.
The height of this page shape.
The width/height ratio is equal to the ratio of the original page.
The rotation the page shape counter-clockwise (360 corresponds to a full circle).

This shape has the contents from the specified page boundary. If the page does not have the specified page boundary, then it will be automatically using the following fallback: ArtBox --> CropBox; TrimBox --> CropBox; BleedBox --> CropBox; CropBox --> MediaBox.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new PageShape from a file with the original size of the page.
member.remarks: Loading PDF documents from a URL is currently not supported. You can use relative paths in a web environment (for example ~/documents/mydoc.pdf)
member.param: The path to the PDF Document.
The password needed to open the given PDF.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.Path
member.summary: Path of the PDF file to load.
member.remarks: If the PDF file was loaded from a stream this value may be . Loading PDF from a URL is not supported. When the path is relative, it is assumed to be relative to the applications current working folder. For web applications, the current working folder is the root folder of the web application.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.PageIndex
member.remarks: This property has no effect if the PageShape was constructed using a Page instance.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.Password
member.summary: Set the password used to open the source PDF document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.PageCount
member.summary: The number of pages in the source PDF document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.PageOrientation
member.summary: The orienation or rotation specified on the Page this PageShape refers.
member.remarks:
The orientation is counter-clockwise in degrees.
You cannot set this property, it's read-only.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.PreserveFields
member.summary: Preserve fields from the source page. Because annotations, and thus widgets, cannot be geometrically transformed in the same way that shapes can, you should not transform the PageShape when you set PreserveFields to true. Default is false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.Rotate
member.summary: Number of degrees by which this page shape is rotated counter-clockwise around its lower-left corner.
member.remarks: Please use Rotation instead. Please note that the rotation has changed from counter-clockwise to clockwise!

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.SkewX
member.summary: Amount of horizontal skew in degrees, clockwise. (default = 0)
member.remarks: The y-axis will be skewed by the given angle.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.SkewY
member.summary: Amount of vertical skew in degrees, clockwise. (default = 0)
member.remarks: The x-axis will be skewed by the given angle.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.Width
member.summary: The width of this page shape in points.
member.remarks: This must be a positive (non zero) number.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.Height
member.summary: The height of this page shape in points.
member.remarks: This must be a positive (non zero) number.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.KeepAspectRatio
member.summary: If KeepAspectRatio is set to true, the size is calculated from the width and height so that the width/height ratio is equal to the ratio of the original page. If set to false, the specified. width and height are used and the page will in general appear distorted.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.PageShape.PageBoundary
member.summary: Specifies which page boundary corresponds to this page shape, the space outside the specified boundary will be clipped.

member.summary: Colors are represented in a manner that preserves or emphasizes saturation.

member.summary: Colors are represented in a manner that provides a pleasing perceptual appearance.

member.summary: The width of the virtual canvas on which child shapes are positioned. This implies a coordinate system transformation.
member.remarks:
Setting the to anything other than will cause the child shapes to scale appropriately.
Fields cannot be scaled. Using virtual height with fields may lead to unexpected results.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ShapeCollection.VirtualHeight
member.summary: The height of the virtual canvas on which child shapes are positioned. This implies a coordinate system transformation.
member.remarks:
Setting the to anything other than will cause the child shapes to scale appropriately.
Fields cannot be scaled. Using virtual height with fields may lead to unexpected results.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ShapeCollection.Clip
member.summary: Clip child shapes. Default is true.
member.remarks: Clipping does not work on fields.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ShapeCollection.ClipPath
member.summary: The clip path to use.
member.remarks: Will be used if Clip = true, and at least 1 segment is added to the collection. Otherwise the clip path will be the rectangle defined by this ShapeCollection.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ShapeCollection.Compose
member.summary: Overide this method to construct custom shapes.
member.remarks: To build custom shapes, derive a class from Shapes and provide an implementation of Compose. This method is called just before PDF generation starts. Add shapes to create a custom appearance.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape
member.summary: Renders one or more lines of text with "simple" xhtml markup.

remarks.para: For the SimpleXhtml shape the formatting is restricted to what is possible in rich text form fields in PDF. In PDF, rich text strings consist of XML that is a subset of the XFA text specification, which is itself a subset of the XHTML 1.0 specification.
Text will wrap at the specified of the shape. You can set layout properties such as alignment and indentation.
The origin (X and Y properties) is the top-left position.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new SimpleXhtmlShape.

member.summary: The horizontal alignment.

member.summary: Will be fired when a word has to be broken on a line end.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.LineSpacing
member.summary: Extra spacing between lines in points.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.TabStops
member.summary: Allows you to define points to jump to when a tab character is encountered.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.FlowDirection
member.summary: The read direction of text elements (fragments).
member.remarks: The fragments contained can have a different read direction to allow left-to-right reading elements (numbers) in right to left text.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.MaxFontSize
member.summary: The maximum font size the auto-sized text will be (default = 24).
member.remarks: If this MultilineTextShape isn't auto-sized, this property isn't used at all.

member.summary: Width of this SimpleXhtmlShape.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.MeasuredHeight
member.summary: The measured height is the space that will be used when drawing this shape on the page. This height is calculated with the current text available, it respects the Width property and other properties.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.MeasuredWidth
member.summary: The measured width is the space that will be used when drawing this shape on the page. This width is is calculated with the current text available, it respects the Width property and other properties. It can be less than the Width, if only a few data is available (or is forced broken after short words).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.SimpleXhtmlShape.Text
member.summary: The rich text string to display formatted as xhtml.
member.remarks: Supported tags include: strong, b, em, i, span, p and a wide variety of CSS styles like font, font-family, font-size, color, text-decoration etc.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.TextShape.Bold
member.summary: If set, the text appears bold. Note that the boldness is simulated by using a thicker stroke. It is preferrable to use a bold font if possible. E.g. use arialbd.ttf for bold Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to a Bold font.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.TextShape.HorizontalScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal scaling 0.0 - 1.0. 1.0 by default.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.TextShape.Italic
member.summary: If set, the text appears italic. Note that the italicness is simulated by skewing the text slightly. It is preferrable to use an italic font if possible. E.g. use ariali.ttf for italic Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to an Italic font.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.TextShape.TextBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the text bytes.
member.remarks: It turned out that in some fonts the ToUnicode table mapes to different characters and it leads to different text in a result of the CreateShapes roundtriping. Therefore in order to preserve the original text in untouched text shapes we save its text bytes and write them back unless the text shape was modified.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.MatrixTransform.Rotate(System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the transform the given amount of degrees.
member.remarks: The direction of the rotation depends on the coordinate system. If the origin is at the top left corner - with the y-axis going down -, the rotation will be clockwise. This is the case for interactors (and WinForms/WPF). If the origin is at the bottom left corner - with the y-axis going up -, the rotation will be counter-clockwise. This is the case for PDF shapes.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ContextFieldsReplacer
member.summary: Implementation of context field replacement.
member.remarks: This implementation derives implements both IReplacer and Context. Context is used in TallPDF4. IReplacer is the old interface that is used in TallPDF3. This implementation is just a way to bridge the gap between Tall 3 and 4 without having to use too many ifdefs in the code. It should be removed when support for Tall 3 ends.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment
member.summary: The fragment class represents a piece of text.
member.remarks:
The fragment is a part of a multiline text shape or a text paragraph. All text of a fragment is typeset equally. Fragments allow to contain pieces of text with different font, color or have a different decoration (bold, italic, underlined,...).
A fragment may refer to a paragraph throug a . In this case the text may contain fields that will be replaced by properties of the referenced paragraph.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.Text
member.summary: The content of this fragment.
member.remarks:
By default all whitespace characters (tabs, spaces and newlines) will be removed. To render pre-formatted text set PreserveWhiteSpace to true.
Use SuppressSpaceBefore to prevent a space from being inserted before this fragment.
Fragments may contain context fields. These fields will be resolved to values when is true.
The following fields are related to page numbering:
FieldDescription
#p Current page number (starting at 1).
#P Total number of pages in the document.
#Q Total number of pages in this set. A page set starts when Section.RestartPageNumber is set.
The following fields are restricted to header and footer fragments:
Field Description
#c<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The caption of the last i-level heading.
#l<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The label of the last heading at level i.
#<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The last heading number at level i (1, 2, etc.).
#a<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The last heading number at level i (1, 2, etc.). Formatted alphabetically, lowercase.
#A<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The last heading number at level i (1, 2, etc.). Formatted alphabetically, uppercase.
#i<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The last heading number at level i (1, 2, etc.). Formatted as roman numerals, lowercase.
#I<i> <i> ranges from 0 to 9. The last heading number at level i (1, 2, etc.). Formatted as roman numerals, uppercase.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.Bold
member.summary: Get or set if the text appears bold.
member.remarks: Note that the boldness is simulated by using a thicker stroke. It is preferrable to use a bold font if possible. E.g. use arialbd.ttf for bold Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to a Bold font.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.Italic
member.summary: Get or set if the text appears italic.
member.remarks: Note that the italicness is simulated by skewing the text slightly. It is preferrable to use an italic font if possible. E.g. use ariali.ttf for italic Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to an Italic font.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.DetermineReadDirection(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.ReadDirection)
member.summary: Get the readdirection for the fragments words.
member.remarks: If the read direction for the fragment has been specified the assigned value is used. If the direction is set to "InheritFromParagraph" (Default) the paragraph's flow direction is used.
member.param: The flow direction from the paragraph.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.ReadDirection
member.summary: Get or set the direction of the text fragment.
member.remarks: If the read direction is set to "InheritFromParagraph" the read direction of the paragraph is used. The default value of the read direction is "InheritFromParent"

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.KeepWithNext
member.summary: Get or set if the next fragment is started on the same line as this fragment.
member.remarks: Make sure this fragment always appears on the same line as the next fragment. A fragment that has keep with next set will not break across lines.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.FontSize
member.summary: Font size in points. Fontsize 0 will autosize when the fragment is single in a MultilineTextShape.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.Font
member.summary: The font for this fragment. You can use one of the 14 standard PDF fonts or a TrueType font. Note that the TrueType functionality is available in the Professional edition only.
member.example:
C#
myFragment.Font = Font.Helvetica;
XML
<paragraph type="textparagraph" > <fragment font="helvetica" fontsize="10"> This text is in 10pt Helvetica </fragment> </paragraph>

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.PreserveWhiteSpace
member.summary: Preserve spaces, tabs (\t), carriage returns (\r) and line feeds (\n). Set this property to true to include preformatted text like code fragments.

remarks.para: Fragments that have PreserveWhiteSpace set to true cannot be Justified because justification modifies the whitespace between words.
Use TabSize to set the width of tabs in spaces.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.TrimStartOfLine
member.summary: If PreserveWhiteSpace is true, for each (see remarks) line the leading whitespaces will be removed.
member.remarks:
The first line, from the container this fragment is used in, will not be trimmed. Also the first line after a carriage return will not be trimmed.
So basically only the lines that are automatically broken by this component (due to the fact that there is no more space left on the current line to place the characters) will be trimmed.
Meaningless when PreserveWhiteSpace is false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Fragment.TabSize
member.summary: If PreserveWhiteSpace is true, each tab character (\t) is replaced by TabSize number of spaces. Default is 3.
member.remarks: Meaningless when PreserveWhiteSpace is false.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition
member.summary: Definition for all cells in a column of a table.
member.remarks:
To be able to simply assign formatting parameters to the cells in a table it is possible to assign a TableColumnDefinition.
The following cell properties will be overridden by the column definition:
PreferredWidth
In points, real world measurements (3cm) or relative (10%).
Fixed
Gives this cell a higher priority in case the cell width has to be re-adjusted to make the table fit on the page/in the given space.
FitToContent
Specifies if the cell has to be adjusted to the contents size (if possible). For a line of text this is when all text is on 1 line.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Column class.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.#ctor(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Unit)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the TableColumnDefinition class with the given settings.
member.param: The preferred width for all cells in points or parsable format (like 3cm or 40%).

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.#ctor(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Unit,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the TableColumnDefinition class with the given settings.
member.param: The preferred width for all cells in points or parsable format (like 3cm or 40%).
Specifies if the cell has to be resized to fit to the content.
Specifies if the size of the cell is fixed.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Get or set the preferred width for all cells in this column.
member.remarks: The width may be specified as a fixed value (in points) or a value that can be parsed (like 3cm or 25%).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.Fixed
member.summary: Get or set if the width of the cell/column is fixed.
member.remarks:
When it is not possible to respect the preferred width of all cells in the table, the preferred width of a Fixed cell will have precedence over non-fixed cells.
By default this is turned off (false).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TableColumnDefinition.FitToContent
member.summary: Get or set if the width of the cell/column has to grow with the content.
member.remarks:
The width of this cell will be set to the minimum value that does not break any included paragraph across lines. If the available space does not allow this, the content is broken anyway.
By default this is turned off (false).

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.FitPolicy
member.summary: Different policies for handling image paragraphs that do not fit the available space.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.FitPolicy.ThrowException
member.summary: If the image width or height exceed the available space, an ImageSizeException is thrown.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.FitPolicy.Shrink
member.summary: If the image width or height exceed the available space, the image shrinks to fit. Depending on KeepAspectRatio, it will keep the aspect ratio or not. The image will never grow.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.FitPolicy.Clip
member.summary: If the image width or height exceed the avaiable space, the image is clipped. Either the right and/or bottom part is clipped.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell
member.summary: A cell is part of a row. A cell has a collection of paragraphs.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Cell class.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.Paragraphs
member.summary: Get all paragraphs in this cell.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Get or set the vertical alignment of the contained Paragraphs collection.
member.remarks:
Setting or getting this property is equivalen to setting and getting the VAlignment property of the Paragraphs collection. Vertical alignment works within space available in the . Use the Row's to create room for alignment if needed.
For horizontal alignment, set the on each Paragraph in the cell.
This property maps directly to the property on the Paragraphs collection. It is provided because the Paragraphs class is not normally used in XML declarations.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Get or set the cells preferred width.
member.remarks: An attempt is made render the cell with this width. This property is ignored if FitToContent is true.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.FitToContent
member.summary: Get or set if the width of the cell has to grow with the content.
member.remarks: The width of this cell will be set to the minimum value that does not break any included paragraph across lines. If the available space does not allow this, the content is broken anyway. By default this is turned off (false).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.Fixed
member.summary: Get or set if the width of the cell is fixed.
member.remarks: When it is not possible to respect the preferred width of all cells in the table, the preferred width of a Fixed cell will have precedence over non-fixed cells. By default this is turned off (false).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Cell.ColSpan
member.summary: Get or set the number of columns that this cell spans.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Drawing
member.summary: Can hold shapes (Graphical elements).
member.remarks: The drawing class is a specialization of paragraph. All members of paragraph are members of drawing as well. Like any paragraph, a drawing can be added to any paragraph collection, e.g. section, table cell, header and footer. The drawing has a collection of shapes. You draw by adding shapes to this collection.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Drawing class.
member.remarks: Creates a new Drawing instance.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Drawing class with the given width and height.

member.summary: Get or set the width in points.

member.summary: Get or set the height in points.

member.summary: Get or set the collection of shapes.

member.summary: Clones a ParagraphCollection.

member.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.Paragraph
member.summary: Create a Paragraph and assign it to this property in the event handler.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.Left
member.summary: The horizontal position of the left edge of this paragraph. This position does not account for left indentation.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.Top
member.summary: The vertical position of the top edge of this paragraph. This position does not account for spacing before.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.Width
member.summary: The available width for this paragraph. This width does not account for left or right indentation.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.Data
member.summary: User-defined data. This member points to the same object as the member. You typically store a reference to a data source such as a SqlDataReader or XmlReader object.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintParagraphEventArgs.MoreContent
member.summary: Set to true if more content is available.
member.remarks:
If set to true, the event will fire again so more content can be added. If set to false, the event will not fire again and generation will continue with the next section (if any).
MoreContent is only meaning-full when Paragraph is not null/nothing, otherwise it's evaluated as false.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintRowEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintRowEventArgs.Data
member.summary: Get the user-defined data, maps to .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintRowEventArgs.Row
member.summary: Get or set the row to be printed.
member.remarks: The event handler will set this to a new row. If (default), the PrintRowEvent event will not occur again.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintRowEventArgs.PageNumber
member.summary: Get or set the page number of the page where this row starts.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PrintRowEventArgs.MoreContent
member.summary: Get or set if more content is available.
member.remarks: If set to true, the event will fire again so more content can be added. If set to false, the event will not fire again.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.RollbackParagraphEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.RollbackParagraphEventArgs.Position
member.summary: Get the top position of paragraph on page.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.RollbackParagraphEventArgs.Rollback
member.summary: Get or set if the paragraph has to be rolled back / discarded.
member.remarks: If true, the paragraph is not printed and will be discarded. You can add the paragraph again the next time event is fired. Default value is true.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TransformParagraphEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TransformParagraphEventArgs.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Get the amount of vertical translation of this paragraph.
member.remarks: The Top and Bottom arguments of the PrintParagraph, BreakParagraph, ContinueParagraph and EndParagraph must be increased by the value of this property to determine the final position of this paragraph.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Heading
member.summary: Headings are NumberedItems that appear in the table of contents.
member.remarks: The Heading class is a specialization of NumberedItem. All members of NumberedItem are members of Heading as well. A heading marks the start of a block of text at a certain outline level. Headings appear as an hierarchy of bookmarks in the PDF viewer.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Heading class.
member.remarks: Create a new heading with outline level 0.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Heading class with the given outline level.
member.seealso: For the resolved context field definition.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Heading.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Heading class with given number or bullet format and outline level.
member.seealso: For the resolved context field definition.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image
member.summary: A paragraph that holds image (graphical) data.
member.remarks: The image class is a specialization of paragraph. Use this class to place a raster image on the page.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class.
member.remarks: Create a new, uninitialized image.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from an image file.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from an image file and select the frame index.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a GDI+ bitmap.
member.remarks: The frame index will be 0, not the current active frame index. The referenced bitmap must be disposed by the client (caller) after the pdf document (page with this Image) is written

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a GDI+ bitmap.
member.param: The bitmap will be disposed by this component (callee)
member.remarks:
Create a new image from a GDI+ bitmap and specify if the bitmap must be disposed by the callee.
The frame index will be 0, not the current active frame index When setting disposeBitmap to true, the bitmap is disposed when this Image class is release from memory. Note that if this instance of the bitmap is used multiple times an error will be thrown if this bitmap is used after this Image class is removed from memory

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a GDI+ bitmap and select the frame index.
member.remarks:
Create a new image from a GDI+ bitmap and select the frame index.
The referenced bitmap must be disposed by the client (caller) after the pdf document (page with this Image) is written.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a GDI+ bitmap and select the frame index.
member.param: The bitmap will be disposed by this component (callee)
member.remarks:
Create a new image from a GDI+ bitmap, select the frame index and specify if the bitmap must be disposed by the callee.
When setting disposeBitmap to true, the bitmap is disposed when this Image class is release from memory. Note that if this instance of the bitmap is used multiple times an error will be thrown if this bitmap is used after this Image class is removed from memory.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a stream of binary data.
member.remarks: Create a new Image from a stream of binary data. The stream is not closed when the image is disposed. Make sure it remains open until Document.Write is completed.
member.param: The stream containing the binairy image data.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the image class from a stream of binary data.
member.remarks: Create a new Image from a stream of binary data. When setting disposeStream to true, the stream is disposed when this Image class is released from memory. Note that if this instance of the stream is used multiple times an error will be thrown if the stream is used after this Image class is removed from memory.
member.param: The stream containing the binairy image data.
The stream will be disposed by this component.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.GetWebCredentials
member.summary: Occurs when a image is loaded from a weblocation to retrieve the credentials needed.
member.remarks:
Set the credentials in the arguments to perform authentication.
To authenticate using the user running the application or the impersonated user (on ASP.NET) supply System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultCredentials.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.ProcessTextData(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize this object from an XmlReader.
member.param: An XmlReader positioned on an node that represents this object.
member.exception: Occures when invalid Base64 data is encountered.
Occures when image data has already been loaded.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.Path
member.summary: Get or set the absolute, relative or virtual path of the image file.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.MaskColor
member.summary: Get or set the color that will act as the transparent color.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.Compression
member.summary: Get or set the compression applied to the image data inside the PDF document.
member.remarks: This is a best-effort setting. Images that are already compressed will in most cases not be recoded to another compression. Uncompressed images will honor the compression setting.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.FrameIndex
member.summary: Get or set the 0-Based index of the frame to display.
member.remarks: Most images contain only 1 frame. TIFF images may contain more than one frame, use this proeprty to select the frame to display in the PDF document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.FrameCount
member.summary: Get the number of frames in the image.
member.remarks: Most images contain 1 frame. Use to select the frame to display.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.IgnoreAlpha
member.summary: Get or set if the alpha transparancy layer is ignored.
member.remarks: Set to true to completely ignore alpha transparency in the image. If no alpha information is available this setting is ignored. Default value is false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.InvertCmykChannels
member.summary: Set to true to invert the colors in a CMYK image.
member.remarks: Default = false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.FitPolicy
member.summary: Get or set the fit policy of the image
member.remarks: What to do if this image does not fit the available space.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.Width
member.summary: Get or set the width of this image in points.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.Height
member.summary: Get or set the height of this image in points.
member.remarks: Only used if KeepAspectRatio is set to false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.KeepAspectRatio
member.summary: Get or set if the aspect ratio is respected when resizing.
member.remarks: If set to true, the Height is calculated from the Width to keep the aspect ratio.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Image.Clone
member.summary: Clones a ParagraphCollection.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem
member.summary: A textparagraph that has a number reference.
member.remarks: The NumberedItem class is a specialization of TextParagraph. All members of TextParagraph are members of NumberedItem as well.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the NumberedItem class.
member.remarks: Create a new NumberedItem with empty number format and 0 outline level.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the NumberedItem class with given number format.
member.param: Format of number or bullet part.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the NumberedItem class with given 0-based outline level.
member.param: Outline Level of this numbered item.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the NumberedItem class with given 0-based outline level and number format.
member.param: Outline level of this numbered item.
Format of number or bullet part.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.NumberAlignment
member.summary: Get or set horizontally alignment of the number part of this item.
member.remarks: The left and right edges against which alignment occurs, is determined by the alignment of the item itself and the left and right indentation of the number part.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.NumberLeftIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the left indentation of the number part.
member.remarks: The indentation respects the left margin of the current section.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.NumberRightIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the right indentation of the number part
member.remarks: The indentation respects the left indentation of the body of this item.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.NumberFragments
member.summary: Get the content of the number part of this item.
member.remarks: These fragments may contain fields like #0, #1 and #a0 that will be resolved like heading fragments. The difference between a numbered item and a heading is that a heading appears in the document outline while a numbered item does not.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.Level
member.summary: 0-based outline level of this heading. E.g. 0 may be the outline level of a chapter.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.RestartNumbering
member.summary: Get or set if the numbering at this level is restarted.
member.remarks: The heading number of this paragraph will be the value assigned to . The default value is 1. Note that the numbers at a lower level are not reset.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.RestartNumberingAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the number to start the numbered item range with.
member.remarks: This value is set when is set to true. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.Replace(System.String)
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.Clone
member.summary: Clones a NumberedItem.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.NumberedItem.updateDynamicContent(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document)
member.summary: Calls the compose method of the paragraph.
member.remarks: Ensures the updateDynamicContent method of the included FragmentCollection is called as well.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph
member.summary: The paragraph class is the base class for a number of specialized classes.
member.remarks:
A paragraph is part of exactly one section. Specializations are TextParagraph, Table, Image and Drawing. These classes may be further specialized. The following applies to all special paragraphs.
An empty paragraph will not render anything, not even SpacingBefore and SpacingAfter.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.BreakParagraph
member.summary: Occurs when a paragraph is broken across pages.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.RollbackParagraph
member.summary: Occurs when a paragraph is rolled back due to a text flow constraint.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.EndParagraph
member.summary: Occurs when a paragraph ends.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.ContinueParagraph
member.summary: Occurs when a paragraph continues.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.TransformParagraph
member.summary: Occurs when a paragraph is transformed e.g. due to vertical alignment.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Actions
member.summary: The actions that will be executed when the paragraph is clicked.
member.remarks: The actions are executed by the PDF reader application.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Label
member.summary: Get or set the label for this paragraph.
member.remarks: This attribute can be referenced using the #l field.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Caption
member.summary: This attribute can be referenced using the #c field.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.SpacingBefore
member.summary: Get or set the number of added user space units above the rendered paragraph.
member.remarks: If this paragraph is at the top of the page the spacing is omitted.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.SpacingAfter
member.summary: Get or set the number of added user space units below the rendered paragraph.
member.remarks: This spacing may be omitted at the bottom of the page. In other words, it cannot cause a page break.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.LeftIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the left side indent for this paragraph.
member.remarks: For this paragraph only, the left margin shifts to the right by the amount specified. Can be negative (implies left shift).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.RightIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the right side indent for this paragraph.
member.remarks: For this paragraph only, the right margin shifts to the left by the amount specified. Can be negative (implies right shift).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Get or set the horizontal alignment of the paragraph.
member.remarks: How the complete paragraph is horizontally aligned on the page with respect to the left and right page margins.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Note
member.summary: Get or set the note to be inserted.
member.remarks: The note is inserted in the left margin of the paragraph.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Compose(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document)
member.summary: Implement this method in a derived class to generate content dynamically.
member.remarks: This method will be called just before PDF generation starts. It allows you to setup custom content in derived classes.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.DoNotBreak
member.summary: Get or set if a paragraph may be broken on page edges.
member.remarks: If possible, this paragraph will not be broken across two pages. If a paragraph cannot be rendered entirely on the remaining available page space, it will start on the next page leaving some blank space.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.KeepWithNext
member.summary: Get or set if the next paragraph needs start on the same page.
member.remarks: If possible, at least some of this paragraph will be rendered on the same page as at least some of the next paragraph. Insufficient space causes a TextFlowException.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.CancelTransaction
member.summary: Indicates if the transaction has to be cancelled and the paragraph has to be moved on the next page.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.StartOnNewPage
member.summary: Get or set if the paragraph needs to start on a new page.
member.remarks: Start this paragraph on a new page (add page break before). Ignored if the paragraph already start on a new page.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.StartOnNewColumn
member.summary: Get or set if the paragraph needs to start on a new column.
member.remarks: Start this paragraph on a new column (add column break before). Ignored if the paragraph already starts on a new column.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.ID
member.summary: Get or set the ID for referencing the paragraph.
member.remarks: A fragment can refer to this paragraph by settings its ReferenceID property equal to this property. This is an alternative for setting the Reference property of a fragment to this paragraph. This is primarily relevant for making references in an XML file.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Clone
member.summary: Clones a Paragraph.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.MarkReferenced
member.summary: Marks the paragraph as referenced.
member.remarks:
This is called when assigning the paragraph directly (object reference). If no ID is set it fails during the generation. This ensures a ID is set.
This ID can NOT be used for referencing!

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.Replace(System.String)
member.summary: For internal use only

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.transactionStarted
member.summary: Reports the overloaded class that a transaction has been started.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.transactionCancelled
member.summary: Reports the overloaded class that a transaction has been canceled.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.transactionCommitted
member.summary: Reports the overloaded class that a transaction has been committed.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.FlushAnnotations
member.summary: Flushes all annotations stored for future adjustments (moving/aligning). Can be overridden by a derived paragraph type to flush contained elements.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Paragraph.getExternalWidth
member.summary: Returns the total width required for padding, margin, borders and indentation.
member.returns: The space required for padding, margin, borders and indentation.

member.summary: Get the annotations for this paragraph (generated in generate step)

member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Table
member.summary: Table paragraph to hold rows and cells of data.
member.remarks: The table class is a specialization of paragraph. All members of paragraph are members of table as well. Like any paragraph, a table can be added to any paragraph collection, e.g. section, table cell, header and footer. A table is build of rows of cells. A cell contains a collection of paragraphs (possibly tables).

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Table.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Table class.
member.remarks: Creates a new, empty table.

member.summary: Get all rows of this table.

member.summary: Get the column definitions for this table.

member.summary: Get or set if the first row is repeated if the table is broken on pages.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Table.RepeatFirstRows
member.summary: Get or set the number of rows repeated if the table is broken by page edges pages.
member.remarks: The rows repeated are the first rows from the table.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Table.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Get or set the preferred width of the table.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.Table.ForceWidth
member.summary: Get or set if the table width may vary dependinding on content.
member.remarks: If false, the contained rows and cells determine the width of this table, otherwise, the PreferredWidth property is used to set the width of the table.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings
member.summary: This class contains several settings for the HTML or XHTML to PDF conversion.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor initiates a default ConversionSettings object.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.BasePath
member.summary: Absolute or virtual path to the folder containing loadable objects (images, CSS, ...) (default = empty)
member.remarks: If the base path is empty the path info from Path property will be used.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.FontPath
member.summary: Absolute or virtual path to the folder containing fonts. Leave empty to use the systems font folder. (default = empty)
member.remarks: The system font folder may not be accessible during web requests if the anonymous user (IUSR_xxxx) does not have read access to this folder. Clone the required fonts into a different folder within the website instead.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.Credentials
member.summary: The credentials used to supply to a password protected web-site. (default null)
member.remarks: These credentials are supplied to the default resource loader only, if you create a custom resource loaded, you should take care of this yourself in the custom version.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.CustomResourceLoader
member.summary: An optional resource loader which has the first opportunity to retrieve additional files. (default null)
member.remarks: If LoadResource returns null/nothing the default resource loader will be used as second change.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.EnableLinks
member.summary: Convert the link elements (A with href) from the Xhtml into PDF links. (default = true)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.EnableTooltips
member.summary: Convert Tooltip elements from the Xhtml into PDF. (default = true)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.EnableForms
member.summary: Convert the Form elements from the Xhtml into PDF fields. (default = true)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.ExecuteJavaScript
member.summary: Constant, set to false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.StyleSheets
member.summary: The user style sheets that will be applied by the agent.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.UseDtd
member.summary: Whether the DTD specified by the content-type should be loaded and used. (default = false)
member.remarks: Setting this property to true can result in output improvements, however will result is performance loss. Setting to true raises an exception when no content type is defined and entity names must be resolved.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.ContentFitBehavior
member.summary: The behavior the content fit. (default = ScaleToWidth)

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.FixedWidth
member.summary: The fixed width this conversion use. (default 1000)
member.remarks: Applicable when ContentFitBehavior.FixedWidth only.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.TextEncoding
member.summary: This enum specifies if and howto the HTML content (text property only) should be decoded before processed. (default is None)
member.remarks: This is needed if you want to include non wellformed HTML or wellformed HTML with a CDATA section into XML.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ConversionSettings.FontEmbedMode
member.summary: This enum specifies if and how to embed TrueType fonts

member.summary: Holds the style sheet definition.

member.summary: Creates a new CssStyleSheet.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.CssStyleSheet.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new CssStyleSheet.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the location of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is a complete url
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- the application is running in a web context: the web path is resolved locally.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.CssStyleSheet.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new CssStyleSheet.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the loaction of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is already a complete url
- basepath is a url, appends the stylesheetName
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- path is a local file (relative to given basepath)
- the application is running in a web context: the web path is resolved locally.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.
Base path for loading path and included style sheets.
