member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.CssStyleSheet.ApplyStyleSheetFromPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Process a batch of styles from a given location and apply them to the current stylesheet.
member.remarks:
This 'wrapper' tries to resolve the loaction of the stylesheet by checking various types. The first matching is evaluated:
- path is already a complete url
- basepath is a url, appends the path
- path is a local file (relative to current working folder)
- path is a local file (relative to given basepath)
- the application is running in a web context: the web paths are resolved locally.
member.param: The (relative) (web)path to the stylesheet to load.
The base path to load the style sheet from.

Base path for loading included style sheets.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.PdfWidthHelper
member.summary: Width helper for PDF.

member.summary: Calculate the used width based on the inner shapes.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ScaleBehavior
member.summary: This enum specifies the behavior of the page's scaling.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ScaleBehavior.DoNotScale
member.summary:
In this mode the content width will be exact the same as specified by the section/area, it will be the PageSize minus the left and right margin.
No scale will be applied by the engine, the content can be flowed over multiple pages.
Notice: 96 pixels correspond to 72 points = 96 DPI.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ScaleBehavior.SpecifyWidth
member.summary:
In this mode the content width will be those which is specified by the FixedWidth property (default 1000).
The content can be flowed over multiple pages.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ScaleBehavior.ScaleToWidth
member.summary:
In this mode the engine will automatically add a scale, so that the width of the HTML page will fit in the available content width. (this is the default setting)
The content can be flowed over multiple pages.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.ScaleBehavior.ScaleToSinglePage
member.summary:
In this mode the engine will add a scale so that the complete HTML will fit in both the width and the height of the available content.
The content can be very small in large HTML documents.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextEncoding
member.summary: This enum specifies if and howto the HTML content (text property only) should be decoded before processed.
member.remarks: This is needed if you want to include non wellformed HTML or wellformed HTML with a CDATA section into XML.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextEncoding.None
member.summary: The HTML content (text property only) will not be processed. (default)

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextEncoding.Base64
member.summary: The HTML content (text property only) will be base64 decoded, before other processing will be done.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextEncoding.Html
member.summary: The HTML content (text property only) will be HTML decoded, before other processing will be done.

member.summary: Renders HTML content as PDF.
member.remarks: DISCLAIMER: XhtmlPargraph tries its best to convert any XHTML to PDF. The output may not be identical to that of a major browser. It is recommended to use XhtmlParagraph in a controlled environment where the features used by your XHTML documents can be tested before being used.

member.remarks:
The content of the file will be used to convert into PDF.
It is not allowed to set both the Path property as well as the Text property.

member.summary: Determines the base path depending on the value of some properties.

If the BasePath property has been set, this value is returned.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph
member.summary: The textparagraph holds text data to be flowed on the page.
member.remarks: The text paragraph is a specialization of the paragraph class. The text paragraph represents a block of text than spans 1 or more lines. The text is stored in 1 or more fragments.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the TextParagraph class.
member.remarks: Creates a new, empty text paragraph with default properties.

member.summary: Will be fired when a word has to be broken on a line end.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.TabStops
member.summary: Allows you to define points to jump to when a tab character is encountered.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.Justified
member.summary: Get or set if the text is justified.
member.remarks: When a text paragraph is justified, the white space between all words (if any) will be manipulated so that all space between the left and right margin of the page is used. The last line is never justified.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.RtfMode
member.summary: Get or set if the text must use Rtf specific whitespace rules, like justification.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.HangIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the amount of extra LeftIndentation applied to all but the first line.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.FirstLineIndentation
member.summary: Get or set the amount of extra LeftIndentation applied to the first line only.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.LineSpacing
member.summary: Get or set the extra amount of white space between lines.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Paragraphs.TextParagraph.FlowDirection
member.summary: Get or set the flow direction of text elements (fragments).
member.remarks: The fragments contained can have a different read direction to allow left-to-right reading elements (numbers) in right to left text. The text flow direction on a paragraph is the default flow direction for contained fragments.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.SubscriptScale
member.summary: The subscript scale of this font. Multiply with the font size to get the subscript font size.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.SuperscriptScale
member.summary: The superscript scale of this font. Multiply with the font size to get the superscript font size.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.SubscriptOffset
member.summary: The subscript offset is the distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the lower extreme where to place subscript text for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply with the font size to get the offset in points.
member.remarks: This property can be used to vertically align multiple TextShape instances with subscript text.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.SuperscriptOffset
member.summary: The superscript offset is the distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the lower extreme where to place superscript text for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply with the font size to get the offset in points.
member.remarks: This property can be used to vertically align multiple TextShape instances with superscript text.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.FontHeight
member.summary: Height of the font. Divide by 1000 and multiply by font size to get size in points

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.Height
member.summary: The height of this font at a font size of 1 pt. Multiply the height with the font size to get the height in points.
member.remarks:
This is the height specified by the bounding box. This height is used as line spacing.
For TrueType this value is : YMax - YMin (notice that YMin is negative).
member.returns: Height of this font at 1 pt.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.BaselineOffset
member.summary: The distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the visual baseline for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply the value of this property with the font size to get the distance in points.
member.remarks:
This property can be used to vertically align multiple TextShape instances with different heights.
For TrueType this value is : - YMin (notice that YMin is most likely negative, so returning a positive value).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.UnderlineOffset
member.summary: The distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the position of an underline for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply the value of this property with the font size to get the distance in points.
member.remarks: This property can be used to draw underlines.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.DecorationLineWidth
member.summary: The width of decoration lines for a font with a size of 1 pt.
member.remarks: Decoration lines are lines that are drawn to underline or strike-out text amongst others. Multiply the value of this property with the font size to get the line width in points.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.StrikeOutOffset
member.summary: The distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the position of a strikethrough for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply the value of this property with the font size to get the distance in points.
member.remarks: This property can be used to draw strikethroughs.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.XHeight
member.summary: The height of the small letter x this font at a font size of 1 pt. Multiply the x-height with the font size to get the x-height in points.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.Ascender
member.summary: The ascender of this font at a font size of 1 pt. Multiply the ascender with the font size to get the ascender in points.
member.remarks:
For roman font programs: typically the y-value of the top of the lowercase d.
If this font program contains no ascender double.NaN is returned.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.Descender
member.summary: The descender of this font at a font size of 1 pt. Multiply the descender with the font size to get the descender in points.
member.remarks:
For roman font programs: typically the y-value of the bottom of the lowercase p.
If this font program contains no decender double.NaN is returned.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.Font.LineGap
member.summary: The height of the line gap specified inside this font at a font size of 1 pt. Multiply the line gap with the font size to get the line gap in points.
member.remarks: If this font program contains no line gap information double.NaN is returned.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights
member.summary: Font licensing rights.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.Unknown
member.summary: The font licensing rights could not be determined.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.InstallableEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded and permanently installed on the remote system by an application. The user of the remote system acquires the identical rights, obligations and licenses for that font as the original purchaser of the font, and is subject to the same end-user license agreement, copyright, design patent, and/or trademark as was the original purchaser.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.RestrictedLicenseEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font must not be modified, embedded or exchanged in any manner without first obtaining permission of the legal owner. Caution: For Restricted License embedding to take effect, it must be the only level of embedding selected.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.PreviewAndPrintEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded, and temporarily loaded on the remote system. Documents containing Preview & Print fonts must be opened "read-only;" no edits can be applied to the document.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.EditableEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded but must only be installed temporarily on other systems. In contrast to Preview & Print fonts, documents containing Editable fonts may be opened for reading, editing is permitted, and changes may be saved.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.NoSubsetting
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may not be subsetted prior to embedding. Other embedding restrictions may also apply.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.BitmapEmbeddingOnly
member.summary: This setting indicates that only bitmaps contained in the font may be embedded. No outline data may be embedded. If there are no bitmaps available in the font, then the font is considered unembeddable and the embedding services will fail. Other embedding restrictions may also apply.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Border
member.summary: Specifies the border for objects.
member.remarks: A border is a rectangle that can be applied to a table, row and cell. The appearance of a border is defined by the four pens with which the left, right, top en bottom edges are drawn and the brush with which the background is filled. The size and position of a border is determined by the enclosed content.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object
member.summary: Base class of all objects that can be read from XML.
member.remarks:
features most of the logic used to load object declarations from XML. You can use this feature in your own classes by deriving from this class.
Derived classes must have a public parameterless constructor, otherwise it cannot be instatiated.
The XML processor can handle all public properties if:
of type System.String.
that have a 'public static [type] Parse( string )' method (this includes many value-types such as double, bool, etc.
that have public static get-properties that return instances of that type.
enumeration members
The attribute name should match (case-insensitive) the name of the public property. will use Unit.Parse to process doubles.
Use the type attribute to specify derived classes using their fully qualified type name.
To implement custom XML reading, create a class with a public parameterless constructor and add a void Read(XmlReader) method. The XML reader will invoke the Read method right after construction. Note that if you use this approach, you are completely on your own in processing the XML. Make sure that, when the method finishes processing the XML, the XmlReader is positioned at the first node after the end element.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object.Read(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Read from XML element.
member.param: The element that holds the data from which this layout object is read.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Read from XML file.
member.param: The path of the XML file that holds the data from which this layout object is read.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object.Read(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Read from XML reader.
member.remarks: Override this method to implement custom XML reading. When called, the reader is positioned on the start element associated with the type. When the method finishes, the reader must be positioned on the first XML node after the end element (i.e. make sure you consume the end element).
member.param: The XML reader that holds the data from which this layout object is read.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object.readSimpleAggregate(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Read a simple aggregated value. A simple value is a single object that is not a collection.
member.returns: True if the value was succesfully read, false if the value was ignored.
member.remarks: Will throw an exception if the getter for the property returns and a new instance of the class cannot be created.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Object.createNewInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the specified type.
member.remarks: Requires a parameterless constructor.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Metadata.MetadataSchemaCollection.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determine whether the with gicen prefix is in the .
member.returns: True if the prefix is found in this , false otherwise.
member.remarks: The does not accept as a valid value.
member.example:
C#
Document doc = new Document(); doc.Metadata.Create( "tc", "http://www.tallcomponents.com/xmp/schema/v1.0/" ); bool found = doc.Metadata.Contains( "tc" ); //found = true found = doc.Metadata.Contains( "anotherPrefix" ); //found = false
VB.NET
Dim doc as Document = new Document() doc.Metadata.Create( "tc", "http://www.tallcomponents.com/xmp/schema/v1.0/" ) Dim found as Boolean found = doc.Metadata.Contains( "tc" ) 'found = True found = doc.Metadata.Contains( "anotherPrefix" ) 'found = False

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.ZoomFactor
member.summary: The default zoom factor for this document (1 corresponds to 100%).
member.remarks: 0 means that the current value is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.ViewArea
member.summary: The page boundary representing the area of the page to be displayed when viewing the document on the screen.
member.remarks: This entry is intended for prepress applications that manipulate page boundaries. Most consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.ViewClip
member.summary: The page boundary to which the contents of the page are to be clipped when viewing the document on the screen.
member.remarks: This entry is intended for prepress applications that manipulate page boundaries. Most consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.PrintArea
member.summary: The page boundary representing the area of the page to be rendered when printing the document.
member.remarks: This entry is intended for prepress applications that manipulate page boundaries. Most consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.PrintClip
member.summary: The page boundary to which the contents of the page are to be clipped when printing the document.
member.remarks: This entry is intended for prepress applications that manipulate page boundaries. Most consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.Duplex
member.summary: The paper handling option that shall be used when printing the file from the print dialog.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.PrintScaling
member.summary: The page scaling option that shall be selected when a print dialog is displayed for this document.
member.remarks: Default value is AppDefault.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.PickTrayByPdfSize
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the PDF page size shall be used to select the input paper tray.
member.remarks: This setting influences only the preset values used to populate the print dialog presented by a conforming reader.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.NumCopies
member.summary: The number of copies that shall be printed when the print dialog is opened for this file.
member.remarks: Values outside this range shall be ignored. This property will store any integer specified, but Adobe Reader appears not to show values larger than 5 in its document properties panel.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.PrintPageRange
member.summary: The page numbers used to initialize the print dialog box when the file is printed.

remarks.para: This value can be null.
If a range is specified outside the actual pages of the document that this method will store this range, but Adobe Reader may not show it in its document properties panel.
The PDF reference manual erroneously states that the first page is denoted by 1. If you specify a range (0, 3) here, Adobe Reader will list it as (1 - 4) in its document properties panel.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ViewerPreferences.ReadDirection
member.summary: The predominant reading order for the text in the document.
member.remarks: Default is LeftToRight.

member.summary: Clones a ViewerPreferences.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.Duplex.Unspecified
member.summary: Do not specify a duplex setting.
member.remarks: It appears that the presence of this setting has unwanted side effects. E.g. if Duplex is set to Simplex, checking the 'print on both sides' option in the print dialog of the Adobe PDF reader is ignored. By setting Duplex to 'Unspecified', the corresponding entry will be absent in the viewer preferences dictionary.

member.remarks:
double.NaN is used for: n/a or 'use the current value', this depends on the value.

member.summary: The horizontal position (measured from the left in points) of the page that is displayed at the right edge of the page window.
member.remarks:
double.NaN is used for: n/a or 'use the current value', this depends on the value.
Setting this value is not allowed for all PageDisplay values, see enum for details.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.Destination.Top
member.summary: The vertical position (measured from the bottom in points) of the page that is displayed at the top edge of the page window.

double.NaN is used for: n/a or 'use the current value', this depends on the value.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.Destination.Bottom

double.NaN is used for: n/a or 'use the current value', this depends on the value.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.InternalPageDestination
member.summary: Describes a location inside this PDF document.

Allows to specify the pagenumber directly. This allows having references in event driven generation mode.
NOTE: By setting an invalid page (e.g.: page 99 in a 3 page document) this will result in a broken link!

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay
member.summary: Different ways to specifiy how the page is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.PositionZoom
member.summary:
The page is displayed with specified zoom and specified position.
The top and left positions and the zoom are specified by the Top, Left and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination.
The Right and Bottom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitEntire
member.summary: Fit the entire page both horizontally and vertically.
member.para: The Left, Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitHorizontally
member.summary:
Fit the page horizontally.
The top position is specified by the Top property of ExplicitDestination.
The Left, Right, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitVertically
member.summary:
Fit the page vertically.
The left position is specified by the Left property of ExplicitDestination.
The Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitRectangle
member.summary:
Fit the specified rectangle.
The rectangle is specified by the Left, Right, Top and Bottom properties of ExplicitDestination.
The Zoom property of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBox
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents both horizontally and vertically.
The Left, Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBoxHorizontally
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents horizontally.
The top position is specified by the Top property of ExplicitDestination.
The Left, Right, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBoxVertically
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents vertically.
The left position is specified by the Left property of ExplicitDestination.
The Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Navigation.ParagraphDestination
member.summary: Describes a location inside a PDF document.
member.remarks: The paragraph destination is used to construct GoTo actions that jump to a location within the same document. Note that the exact location that the action jumps to is determined by the that the destination references. Setting the position ( e.g. Left and Top ) has no effect.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern
member.summary: A pattern for a pen (e.g. solid, dotted, dashed, etc.).
member.remarks: A DashPattern is an array of numbers that specify alternating lengths of ink followed by no-ink. The array is applied repeatedly to draw the full length of the path to which the pattern is applied.
member.example:
This sample demonstrates how to declare a DashPattern in XML
<document> <section> <paragraph type="drawing" width="200" height="200"> <shape type="lineshape" x="0" y="0" x1="200" y1="200"> <pen width="1" color="red"> <pattern phase="2">1, 1, 5, 5, 20</pattern> </pen> </shape> </paragraph> </section> </document>

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.Solid
member.summary: A solid pattern.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Create a custom pattern with given phase and pattern.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.Dashes
member.summary: The pattern of dashes.
member.remarks: Should be all non zero and non negative values.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.Phase
member.summary: The phase of the pattern.
member.remarks: The phase determines the distance within the pattern at which the line starts drawing.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.Read(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads a dash pattern from XML.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.DashPattern.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new DashPattern from a string description of alternating ink lengths..

remarks.para: This method is provided to enable s to be specified in XML.
The string must be formatted as a list of comma separated positive integers. Each value is a length of alternating ink or whitespace.
The phase defaults to 0.

member.param: A comma separated list of positive integers.
member.returns: A new dash pattern.

member.summary: Compare two DashPatterns.

member.summary: Clones a DashPattern.

member.summary: IClonable implementation. Clones a DashPattern.

member.summary: Compare two sets of dashes.
member.returns: True if equal.

member.summary: Returns base.GetHashCode().

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineCapStyle
member.summary: Different styles for line caps (end-points).

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineCapStyle.Butt
member.summary: Flat end. Ends exactly at end point.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineCapStyle.Round
member.summary: Rounded end. Center lies exactly at end point.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineCapStyle.ProjectingSquare
member.summary: Flat end. The end is drawn half the width of the pen beyond the end point.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineJoinStyle
member.summary: Different styles for line joints.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineJoinStyle.Miter
member.summary: The outer edges of the joining segments are extended until they meet.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineJoinStyle.Round
member.summary: A circle is drawn around the point where the centers of the segments meet.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.LineJoinStyle.Bevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with butt caps.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.Pen
member.summary: A pen defines the characteristics of a line such as color and pattern (solid, dashed, etc.).
member.remarks: Lines, curves and borders are drawn using a pen. A pen defines how line ends are connected () and how open ends are drawn ().

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Pens.Pen.MiterLimit
member.summary: The Miter Limit imposes a maximum on the ratio of the miter length to the line width. When the limit is exceeded, the join is converted from a miter to a bevel. (default = 10.0)
member.remarks: Meaningfull when JoinStyle is LineJoinStyle.Miter only.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity
member.summary: This class encapsulates all security settings of a PDF document. You secure a document by assigning a new instance of this class to the Security property of the Document class. This class is only available in TallPDF.NET Professional.

member.summary: Creates a new password security object.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity.UserPassword
member.summary: User password. You may set this string to "" to allow viewing by anyone but to restrict privileges such as printing.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Owner password. The owner has all privilages, including changing the user password.
member.remarks: The owner password is required. Setting this to "" (an empty string) is valid but will allow anybody to change the security settings on the document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity.EncryptionLevel
member.summary: This encryption level used to encrypt this document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity.Strong
member.summary: Use strong (128-bit key) encryption. Otherwise weak (40-bit key) encryption is used.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Security.PasswordSecurity.StandardSecurityHandler
member.summary: Use an existing SecurityHandler.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Unit
member.summary: Unit is used to convert a wide variety of units to points, which is the unit used in PDF.
member.remarks: A point in PDF is exactly 1/72 inch. This is also known as a PostScript point. This class converts all units to PostScript points.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Actions.ActionCollection.Contains(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Actions.Action)
member.summary: Determine whether an Action is in the ActionCollection.
member.returns: True if the is found in this , false otherwise.
member.remarks: The does not accept a as a valid value.
member.example:
C#
GoToAction goToAction = new GoToAction( page ); UriAction uriAction = new UriAction( "http://www.tallcomponents.com" ); ActionCollection actions = new ActionCollection(); actions.Add( goToAction ); bool found = actions.Contains( goToAction ); //found = true found = actions.Contains( uriAction ); //found = false
VB.NET
Dim goToAction1 as GoToAction = new GoToAction( page ) Dim uriAction1 as UriAction = new UriAction( "http://www.tallcomponents.com" ) Dim actions as ActionCollection = new ActionCollection() actions.Add( goToAction1 ) Dim found as Boolean found = actions.Contains( goToAction1 ) 'found = True found = actions.Contains( uriAction1 ) 'found = False

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Annotations.Widgets.Widget.Persistency
member.summary: The widget's persistency when this document is written.
member.remarks: If a widget is flattened and the Value property for the related field is not set, the field's default value will be used, if no default value is specified this widget is simply removed. If the widget is flattened and the Value is set, appropriate content is drawn in place of this widget. E.g. in case of a multiline text field, the text is wrapped, formatted using the widget's and field's font, font size, orientation, alignment, border and background color. If a widget is not flattened, the widget and the related field is preserved and can still be filled out interactively. If a field is not flattened and the Value property is set, the corresponding value will be entered into the field.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Annotations.Widgets.Widget.UpdateAppearance
member.summary: This updates the appearance of this widget.
member.remarks:
You should call this function when you change at least one of the following items:
The format action in the connected Field (type must be ValueField).
The JavaScript inside the format action.
Document level JavaScript called by the format action.
Note that this function is automatically called when you change any widget or annotation property or set a new ValueField.Value.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.Field.FullName
member.summary: The fully qualified name for this field.

remarks.para: Setting this property will only work if it is a classic PDF document (No Xfa document). For Xfa documents the returned field name is determined dynamically, as there can be fields with names name[0]..name[n] in Xfa. Removing one or more of such fields will result in renaming the remaining fields. This is currently only possible by setting the widget persistency to Flatten or Remove.
Note: Setting this property is NOT thread safe.
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.remarks: Returns -1 for unlimited (not specified).

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.RadioButtonField.getPublicValue(System.String)
member.summary: Convert the passed pdf value (= on value) to the field value (= export value).
member.returns: The coresponding export value. See remarks below.
member.remarks: No matter whether we have an XFA document or a classic one, the field value is always the export value, and the stored value (the V entry) is always the "on" value.

member.summary: Convert the passed field value (= export value) to the value as stored in the pdf file.
member.returns: The coresponding pdf value. See remarks below.
member.remarks: No matter whether we have an XFA document or a classic one, we the field value is always the export value, and the stored value (the V entry) is always the "on" value.

member.summary: Indicates the access permissions granted for this document.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.LockPermission.P1
member.summary: No changes to the document are permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.LockPermission.P2
member.summary: Permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.LockPermission.P3
member.summary: Permitted changes are the same as for 2, as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.summary: Create a new Text field.
member.param: The fully qualified name for this field.

member.summary: Create a field, based on an existing field (used for cloning).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.defaultValue
member.summary: The default value asociated with this field.
member.remarks: In classic PDF documents rich text fields will store the default value as non rich text. You should however set and get rich-text strings. One exception is that the empty string will be returned and excepted as well.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.RichText
member.summary: Specifies whether the text may include styling (also known as rich text)
member.remarks: Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only. Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.Multiline
member.summary: Specifies whether the text span multiple lines
member.remarks: Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only. Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.DoNotScroll
member.summary: Specifies whether long text must be scrolled.
member.remarks:
Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only.
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.SpellCheckAllowed
member.summary: Specifies whether spell-checking is allowed on this field.
member.remarks:
Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only. Please note that setting this value to true will not cause the text to be spell-checked. It just marks the field as eligible for spell-checking.
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.Comb
member.summary: If set, the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLength, and the text is laid out into those combs.
member.remarks:
This property is meaningful only if MaxLength != -1 (meaning not resticted).
Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only.
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum characters that may be entered into this text field.
member.remarks:
-1 means not restricted.
Setting this property is supported in classic PDF documents only.
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.TextField.FormattedValue
member.summary: The Formatted Value.
member.remarks:
for XFA documents the Picture-Clause will be executed. For classic document the FormatAction (JavaScript code) is executed (depending on document.ScriptBehavior setting).
Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

remarks.para: Can throw an ObjectDisposedException if the field was removed from the field collection (dynamic XFA).

member.summary: The value as stored in the PDF field. By default, this is the same as the value of the event. For comboboxes however, the event value is the display value, while the field stores the corresponding export value.

member.summary: The "change" value. This indicates in what way the value was changed. This is used internally, to set the change property of the validate event.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.ValidateValueEventArgs.ChangeEx
member.summary: The export value that corresponds to the change value, if any. Null if the value has no export value. This value is used internally to initialise the changeEx event field.

member.summary: The value of this field. If it's null, it's not replaced by DefaultValue as it's done in rawValue.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.ValueField.ReadOnlyValue
member.summary: This value will prevent this field value from being updated.
member.remarks: This is not the the same as the PDF readonly flag of the field, which only prevents users from changing the field. The ReadOnlyValue flag is used to avoid stack overflows when javascript validation/keystroke handlers are attempting to update a field directly.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.XfaSubField.InvalidateNameCaches
member.summary: Invalidates the cached full name and DataSomExpression.
member.remarks: Both values depend on the position of the element in the underlying XML data. It is expensive to compute them, hence the cached. If however the XML data changes structurally, these cached will need to be invalidated. This is currently only needed during/after field flattening, as there is no other way to remove Xfa fields. Note that we do not support adding new Xfa fields.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Forms.Fields.XfaSubField.BindedDataNode
member.summary: In XFA, when field's Bind.Match="dataref", this index says which instance of data nodes is bound to the field.

member.summary: Adds a (Named)JavaScript to the javascript collection.
member.remarks:
If an unnamed javascript is added to the collection, a name will be created with the following format:
- Fixed component: TC-JS-AN-
- Sequential hex-number: xxxx (Note: performance can be affected when a lot of unnamed scripts are added.)

Use the to generate a table of contents, a list of tables, or any other list of paragraphs.
Implement a handler for the event to render an entry for each paragraph.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the CrossreferenceSection class.

member.summary: Occures for every paragraph in the document.
member.remarks: This event allows you to add content to the section that represents the paragraph. This can be anything, e.g. a simple text paragraph, a table row or nothing.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.CrossreferenceSection.Compose(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document)
member.summary: Occurs during the Compose phase of PDF generation.
member.remarks: Iterates over all paragraphs in the main flow of all sections in the document and fires the event for each paragraph it finds.
member.param: The document that this section belongs to.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Write(System.Web.HttpResponse,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write PDF document to HttpResponse in Declaritive (push) or Event-Driven mode (pull).
member.param: The HTTP response to write to.
Write in Event-Driven mode (pull) if true, write in Declaritve mode (push) if false.
member.exception: Thrown when the HttpResponse is not connected.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Write(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Write PDF document to stream in Declaritive mode.
member.exception: Thrown when the Stream is not writeable.

remarks.para: It is the responsibility of the client (caller) to Flush and Close the .
Please check the turorial on differences in the Push (normal) and Pull (low resource, event driven) mode generation. There are some features that change behavior when using Pull-mode.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Write(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write PDF document to stream in declaritive or Event-Driven mode.

remarks.para: It is the responsibility of the client (caller) to Flush and Close the .
Please check the turorial on differences in the Push (normal) and Pull (low resource, event driven) mode generation. There are some features that change behavior when using Pull-mode.

member.param: Write in Event-Driven mode if true, write in Declaritve mode if false.
member.exception: Thrown when the Stream is not writeable.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Write(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Write document in Event-Driven mode to a stream. The document is read from an XML reader.
member.param: XML specification of the document content.
member.exception: Thrown when the Stream is not writeable.
Thrown when the Stream or the XmlReader is .

remarks.para: It is the responsibility of the client (caller) to Flush and Close the .
Please check the turorial on differences in the Push (normal) and Pull (low resource, event driven) mode generation. There are some features that change behavior when using Pull-mode.

example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <document> <section> <paragraph type="TextParagraph"> <fragment>Hello world from XML!</fragment> </paragraph> </section> </document>

' Create a new document Dim doc As New Document
Dim fs As FileStream = Nothing
Try Dim reader As New Xml.XmlTextReader("layout.xml") fs = New FileStream("out.pdf", FileMode.Create, FileAccess.ReadWrite) ' Write from XML in Event-Driven mode doc.Write(reader, fs) Catch ex As Exception System.Console.WriteLine( "Error: {0}", ex.Message ) Finally If Not fs Is Nothing Then fs.Close() End If End Try

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Write(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Web.HttpResponse)
member.summary: Write document in Event-Driven mode (pull) to HttpResponse. Document is read from an XML reader.
member.remarks:
Sets the following headers:
HeaderValue
ContentTypeapplication/pdf
ContentEncodingUTF8
It is the responsibility of the client (caller) to Flush and Close the .
Please check the turorial on differences in the Push (normal) and Pull (low resource, event driven) mode generation. There are some features that change behavior when using Pull-mode.
member.param: XML specification of the document content.
member.exception: Thrown when the HttpResponse is not connected.
Thrown when the HttpResponse or the XmlReader is .

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Document.Read(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Read from XML reader.
member.remarks:
This override checks that the document node is correct (node name = "document") as otherwise errors are given that are unclear (if a incorrect xml is provided for example.
Override this method to implement custom XML reading. When called, the reader should be positioned on the start element associated with the type. When the method finishes, the reader must be positioned on the first XML node after the end element (i.e. make sure you consume the end element).
Please check the turorial on differences in the Push (normal) and Pull (low resource, event driven) mode generation. There are some features that change behavior when using Pull-mode.
member.param: The XML reader that holds the data from which this layout object is read.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Area
member.summary: An area on a page containing paragraphs.
member.remarks:
An area occupies a rectangle on a page and has paragraphs that will be rendered inside that rectangle. Whether an area appears on a page depends on page traits such as 'first of section', 'last of section', 'odd', 'even' and 'blank'. By default the area will appear on all pages in the section.
The bottom left corner of a page is the origin. The top and left properties are offsets from the origin. The default value of the top property is 0, so the top propery must be set otherwise the area will drop off the end of the page and become invisible.
If an area has insufficient space to render it's contents, some of the content may not be rendered.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Footer
member.summary: An area that is repeated at the bottom of pages in a Section.
member.remarks:
A footer is associated with a section through the OddFooter and EvenFooter properties of the section. The position and the size of a footer is constraint by the page size and page margins of the section. The top position of a footer is equal to the sections bottom margin. The left position of a footer is equal to the left margin of the section. The height of the header is equal to the bottom margin of the section minus the bottom margin of the footer. The width of the footer is equal to the width of the page minus the left and right margin of the section.
If the contents of the footer exceeds the available space, the footer will not be rendered. To include an image inside the footer, make sure it's size is set explicitly so that it fits.
To place a banner at the bottom of the page that uses the full width of the page use an Area and add it to the BackgroundAreas collection.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Footer.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the Footer class.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Footer.BottomMargin
member.summary: Get or set the space between the bottom of the footer and the bottom of the page.
member.remarks: By default the BottomMargin is 0.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Header
member.summary: An area that is repeated at the top of pages in a Section.
member.remarks:
A is associated with a Section through the and properties of the section. The position and the size of a header is constrained by the page size and page margins of the section. The top position of a header is equal to the page height of the section minus top margin of the header. The left position of a header is equal to the left margin of the section. The height of the header is equal to the top margin of the section minus the top margin of the header. The width of the header is equal to the width of the page minus the left and right margin of the section.
If the contents of the header exceeds the available space, the header will not be rendered. To include an image inside the header, make sure it's size is set explicitly so that it fits.
To place a banner at the top of the page that uses the full width of the page use an and add it to the collection.

member.remarks: The generated class will have a top margin of 0.

member.remarks: By default the TopMargin is 0.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section
member.summary: Renders content onto one or more pages using Paragraphs, Headers, Footers and Areas.
member.remarks:
A document has one or more sections that span one or more pages. Within a section a list of paragraphs is rendered in the space available between the margins. A section defines s and s that are repeated on each page. It is also possible to add absolutely positioned s on top of or below the main content.
A section can define one or more columns.
Implent a handler for to insert a header and a handler for .

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.QueryPageSettings
member.summary: Occurs before a new empty page is added to the document.
member.remarks: This event lets you specify the attributes of the new page.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.StartPage
member.summary: Occurs right after a new empty page has been added to the document.
member.remarks: This event lets you add content to the page before the main area is filled with paragraphs. Do not modify page attributes (size, margin) using this event, but use instead.

member.name: E:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.EndPage
member.summary: Occurs right after the main area has been completely filled with paragraphs.
member.remarks: This event lets you add content to the page after the normal content flow ends on this page. Declarative defined page headers, footers and areas will not be displayed.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.Header
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the top of each page of this section.
member.remarks: No header will be rendered if the TopMargin is 0 or too small to fit the header contents. Rendering can be overridden by specifically setting the and/or .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.OddHeader
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the top of each odd page of this section.
member.remarks: No header will be rendered if the TopMargin is 0 or too small to fit the header contents. If the OddHeader has not been specified the generic is returned.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.EvenHeader
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the top of each even page of this section.
member.remarks: No header will be rendered if the TopMargin is 0 or too small to fit the header contents.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.Footer
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the bottom of each page of this section.
member.remarks: No footer will be rendered if the BottomMargin is 0 or too small to fit the footer contents. Rendering for odd or even pages can be overridden by specifically setting the and/or .

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.OddFooter
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the bottom of each odd page of this section.
member.remarks: No footer will be rendered if the BottomMargin is 0 or too small to fit the footer contents.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.EvenFooter
member.summary: Get or set a fixed area at the bottom of each even page of this section.
member.remarks: No footer will be rendered if the BottomMargin is 0 or too small to fit the footer contents.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.StartOnNewPage
member.summary: Get or set if you want this section to start on a new page.
member.remarks:
By default StartOnNewPage is false.
Note that if a section has a different page size than the previous section, it will always start on a new page.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.DoNotBreak
member.summary: Get or set if this section has to be rendered on a single page.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.PageSize
member.summary: Get or set the height and width of all pages in this section in points.
member.remarks: Default page size is Letter and the sizes are in points (1/72 inch).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.CropBox
member.summary: The printed or viewed area of the page.
member.remarks: A rectangle, expressed in points with the origin at the bottom left corner, defining the visible region of default user space. When the page is displayed or printed, its contents are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium in some implementation-defined manner.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.BleedBox
member.summary: A rectangle, expressed in points with the origin at the bottom left corner, defining the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.TrimBox
member.summary: A rectangle, expressed in points with the origin at the bottom left corner, defining the intended dimensions of the finshed page after trimming. May be smaller than the bleed box for printing instructions, cut marks, or color bars.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.Orientation
member.summary: Page orientation in the viewer (counterclockwise).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.Margin
member.summary: Get the width of the whitespace around the main content in points.
member.remarks:
Sizes are given in points (1/72 inch). Default margins are 1.25 inch (90pt) for Left and Right, 1 inch (72pt) for Top and Bottom.
Changing the margins resets the column widths and spacing to their default values.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.RestartPageNumber
member.summary: Get or set the page number of the first page of this section.
member.remarks: When set to -1, page numbering continues from the previous section. This property is ignored when the StartOnNewPage is false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.ExcludeFromPageCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude this section from total pages count.
member.value: true if excludes this section from total pages count; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.ForegroundAreas
member.summary: Get the collection of Area objects that is associated with each page of this Section.
member.remarks:
The objects are placed on top of all other contents on the page. Areas are drawn bottom-up, in the same order the areas were added to this collection. So, the last area top be added is on top.
Note: Area's are only drawn on page end. So if the section fits on a page they are not drawn at all. The last section always ends the page (and it's area's are always drawn).

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Section.BackgroundAreas
member.summary: Get the collection of Area objects that is associated with each page of this Section.
member.remarks:
The objects are placed below of all other contents on the page. Areas are drawn bottom-up, in the same order the areas were added to this collection. So, the last area top be added is on top.
Note: Area's are only drawn on page end. So if the section fits on a page they are not drawn at all. The last section always ends the page (and it's area's are always drawn).

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Annotations.AppearanceProviders.AppearanceProvider
member.summary: This abstract base class can be derived for custom annotation appearances.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Annotations.AppearanceProviders.AppearanceProvider.CanUpdateAppearance(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Annotations.Annotation)
member.summary: Indicates whether this provider is able to update an appearance for the given annotation.
member.returns: True if the provider can create an updated appearance.

remarks.para: By default, this property returns true. In principle, we should return true for any annotation that we support. The trouble is, that there are currently many types of markup annotations that have some fancy appearance. And some of these are not described very well.

Setting this propery to false avoids having to implement complete appearance generators for each of these, and to instantly update these whenever Adobe feels like making things fancier. If false, the appearance will not get updated. It is still possible to move and resize the annotations, but then the existing appearance will be transformed. This is not always ideal, but a lot better than generating some crippled appearance, or no appearance at al.

For some markup even, we never want to change an existing appearance. This is the case for stamps. So for stamps, we always set this propery to false. Note that we can still generate stamp appearance if they do not exist yet.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Annotations.AppearanceProviders.AppearanceProvider.DrawNormal(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Shapes.ShapeCollection,TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Annotations.Annotation)
member.summary: This method draws the normal appearance of an annotation. This method is called when the associated appearance stream of the annotation is updated or if the annotation must be flattened.
member.param: The annotation that must be drawn.

remarks.para: The caller will take care of correct positioning and rotation.
If the annotatation is a widget the associated field can be retrieved through widget.Field.
The appearance stream will not be included unless something has been added to the shape collection.

member.summary: The Properties dictionary as stored in the document.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Layers.LayerDefaultConfig
member.summary: Every layer on the page has to be referenced in documents Root -> OCProperties dictionary as well, otherwise such a layer should be ignored by PDF processor. So the layer should have information about his configuration in OCProperties, and when the page is cloned and added into another document, the layers properties should be added to documents OCProperties dictionary as well. This class stores the following preferences from the optional content configurarion dictionary: ON - checks if the layer is referenced in ON array OFF - checks if the layer is referenced in OFF array AS - an array of usage application dictionaries. Stores in which ones is the layer referenced. Order - an array specifying the order for presentation of optional content groups on user interface. Checks if the layer is referenced in this array.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.PdfFontName
member.summary: The name of the font, as found in the PDF document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.PdfFontNameBytes
member.summary: The bytes of the name of the font, as found in the PDF document.
member.remarks: According to the PDF spec section 5.5.2, "Note that for CJK (Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) fonts, the host font systems font name is often encoded in the host operating systems script. For instance, a Japanese font may have a name that is written in Japanese using some (unidentified) Japanese encoding." The original bytes can help to figure out the indended font name in such a situation.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.PredefinedEncoding
member.summary: The predefined encoding.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.Embedded
member.summary: Whether the font is embedded in the PDF document.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.SystemFontName
member.summary: The system font name. If the font could be resolved and the is , this property contains the name of the system font.

remarks.para: If the properties of the event are not changed at all, the system will use the font as indicated in the Status.
If the event handler changes the SystemFontName the system will try to resolve the font to a system font with the new name.

If the font name was changed by the event handler, and it could not be resolved, a new ResolveFont event will be issued. This event will have , and the SystemFontName will indicate the unknown system font name.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.FontPath
member.summary: The Resolved font path. If the font could be resolved and the is , this value holds a path to the font.

remarks.para: If the properties of the event are not changed at all, the system will use the font as indicated in the .

If the event handler changes the path, the system will try to use the indicated file. Please note that changing the system font name takes precedence. If you want to explicitly refer to a font file, please leave the font name untouched, or set it to null.

If the font path was changed by the event handler, and the indicated file could not be loaded, a new ResolveFont event will be issued. This event will have , and the FontPath will indicate the improper file.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.Bold
member.summary: Specifies a bold variant of a system font.
member.remarks: In many cases, the PDF font name specifies the boldness of the font in the font name itself. For example "TimesNewRoman-Bold". If your system has a "Times New Roman" font, you can set the SystemFontName to "Times New Roman" and set Bold to true. This will normally resolve to the right device font. If the system does have a special bold variant of the Times New Roman font, it will resolve to that.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.Italic
member.summary: Specifies an italic variant of a system font.
member.remarks: In many cases, the PDF font name specifies an italic font in the font name itself. For example "TimesNewRoman-Italic". If your system has a "Times New Roman" font, you can set the FontName to "Times New Roman" and set Italic to true. This will normally resolve to the right device font. If the system does have a special italic variant of the Times New Roman font, it will resolve to that.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.FontRenderMode
member.summary: The mode that will be used to render the font.

remarks.para: If the render mode is , a font will be rendered as a sequence of curved lines (a path) that is subsequently filled by a color. This will result in accurate drawing, but it has a few drawbacks, notably it will increase the size of print jobs and WPF conversion results. It is also possible that text looks blurred, or irregular at low resolutions, which is an artefact of mapping vector graphics onto a low resolution device.

To avoid the problems of "curve" rendering, one may specify that a font is rendered by the underlying graphics system of .Net itself (GDI+, or WPF, depending on the situation). The render mode should then be set to . This will also lead to good results, but only if a font definition is available in a format that .Net can deal with. Usually, this means that the fonts as they occur in a PDF document, have to be mapped onto TrueType font definitions that are installed on the system. The ResolveFont event allows one to do this.

At the moment, we only support RenderAsFont for fonts that are installed on the system (which have Location ). Likewise,
is only supported for fonts that have Status . If one specifies the "wrong" rendermode, another ResolveFont event will be raised that corrects this render mode.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.ResolveFontEventArgs.FontLocation
member.summary: Specifies whether a definition for the font has been found.

member.name: M:TallComponents.Images.ImageData.ResolveTransparentColor(TallComponents.PDF.Layout.Colors.Color)
member.summary: Find the index of a color in the color table to use for color masking. This code first tries an exact match using all color components (RGBA). If no match is found and Alpha is 0, a new search is performed for a color with matching RGB values and the highest possible alpha. If the no alpha is supported a simple RGB match is performed.
member.remarks: Only valid for indexed color models.
member.returns: Index of the color or -1 if not found.

member.summary: The default transparent color.
member.remarks: This is not supported by all image formats.

member.summary: Reads data into a complete array, throwing an EndOfStreamException if the stream runs out of data first, or if an IOException naturally occurs.
member.param: The stream to read data from
The array to read bytes into. The array will be completely filled from the stream, so an appropriate size must be given.

member.name: T:TallComponents.Licensing.License
member.summary: The License class let you check if you have entered a valid license key.
member.remarks: It will check the licenses available for all instances in this app-domain.

member.name: M:TallComponents.Licensing.License.IsValid
member.summary: Check if this component detects a valid license key.
member.remarks: If the license is not valid an evaluation banner will be added to the document.

member.name: M:TallComponents.Licensing.License.GetLicenseInfo
member.summary: This method returns some information which is used to check if the component runs in evaluation mode, or in unlock/purchased mode.

member.name: P:TallComponents.Licensing.KeyGenerator.UseActivationId
member.summary: If set, the activation id will be prefixed to the license key.

member.name: M:TallComponents.Licensing.KeyGenerator.generate(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a new license key that does not expire, based on the runtime attribute.

member.name: M:TallComponents.Licensing.KeyGenerator.generate(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate a new license key, based on the runtime attribute and expiration date.
member.param: Starting date on which the license is valid, in the format MMM-dd-yyyy.
Expiration date, in the format MMM-dd-yyyy. Use the empty string in order not to use an expiration date.
member.returns: A license key. If an expiration date is specified (i.e. expirationDate is not the empty string, a pipe symbol and the date are appended to the key.
member.remarks: The expiration date is appended to the key, because the AppSettings do not allow an extra XML tag or parameter in the configuration file. For consistency we use the same method also if the license is not contained in the configuration file, but elsewhere (attributes, etc.).

member.name: T:TallComponents.Licensing.TallPDFLicenseAttribute
member.summary: License key attribute. Use this attribute to include a license key with your assembly or application.
member.example:
Include the following code in your AssemblyInfo:
C#
using TallComponents.Licensing;
[assembly: TallPDFLicense( "TallPDF.NET 3.0 Server Key", "YourKeyValueHere" )]
VB.NET
Imports TallComponents.Licensing
<Assembly: TallPDFLicense("TallPDF.NET 3.0 Server Key", "YourKeyValueHere")>
The license key name depends on the type of license you have purchased. The value is generated when you activate your license.
You can obtain the license key name and value by logging in to your account on our website.
